title: Autofill
body:
I'm not here to say autofill needs to disappear or it's unfair or unnecessary, just that in it's current form it's broken.

You choose your lanes, lobby pops, you get your chosen lane, the person who got autofilled rages and dodges. You queue again, lobby pops, got your lane you wanted, person who autofilled dodges. Now you queue again, but this time autofill protection is disabled because technically you've got your preferred lane twice even though those game never started. You of course now get autofilled. 

This exact scenario has resulted in LITERALLY 3 days of getting autofilled in every single game I've played. And I mean literally in it's true definition not in the weird way kids use the word now. I'm on day 4 now where across multiple accounts I've played autofill every single game.

Why do queues that other people dodge count toward your autofill protection. If you are in a lobby and someone else dodges that game should count as an autofilled game and your 2 games of autofill protection should not be reduced.

Autofill is not unfair, it is required and it does serve a purpose. But the way it's implemented is broken.

I think #1 games where someone else dodges should count as an autofill game for you and autofill protection should remain active for another 2 games.

and #2 players who were autofilled and dodge a queue should have far higher penalties for the dodge than someone who got their lane

replies.body:
Well that's day 4 finished. 5 games, 5 auto fills. Every single game where I didn't autofilled someone who did dodged.

Why do queue dodgers count towards our autofill protection. It's completely retarded
